comments.content: Seriously, some of the worst baseball uniforms I’ve ever seen.

Umm, why is that yucky? Its a red “C” with a star on it. That star must be quite important to Cuba, since they have it on their flag, too.

Or is Si just upset because of the Comic Sans reference?

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106172750im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/timeline_1979.jpg)
  
Philadelphia Phillies pitcher Larry Christenson, May 19, 1979
The yuck is in reference to pure aesthetics. Obviously designed by someones little brother..who’s ten.
I really don’t think that it is that bad…
HAHAHA. Oh man. That made my day.

\>Or is Si just upset because of the Comic Sans reference?

Not upset - just couldn’t watch the game last night without thinking of the Comic Sans euro. I’d agree that the World Baseball Classic uniforms were pretty bad (unimaginative), but the Cuban outfits were better than most.

World Baseball Classic is a commercial venture by Major League Baseball and has nothing really to do with International competition.

The uniforms and equipment were probably bid on by companies and designed by Bud Selig. It was all for show since Mike Piazza probably doesn’t have an Italian passport. Just like the drug testing, that poor Korean pitcher only got to play in the first game before being made an example of.
